poem:
**Outer Hebrides**

He hides where rain  
files the rocks to bone,  
a man with war under his skin,  
and a dog, faithful as hunger.  
The child arrives—  
small flare against the peat-dark.  
Then the engines of London  
turn; men in neat coats  
remember him.  
Achilles again,  
sulking in his tent,  
until the old violence wakes.
